subject: Re: [junit] Difference running junit in ant compared to Eclipse
msgSnippet: We had differences between running in netbeans , eclips and ant in eclips. The order in whitch the tests are run is not fixed and bad written tests could run
messageBody:
We had differences between running in netbeans , eclips and ant in eclips.
The order in whitch the tests are run is not fixed and bad written
tests could run in one order but not in another.
I guess you should look for manipulation of static fields.

Bart


2007/3/7, eraonel <eraonel@...>:
>
> Hi,
>
> I execute a Junit test in Eclipse fine. Then when I run the same test
> in Ant I get a NullPointerException.
> Have anyone experienced the same problem?
>
> Any hints!
>
> cheers,
>
> //mikael
